means: 困惑的，茫然的，不知所措的
使困惑，使发呆( bemuse的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Mr. Sebastian was looking at the boys with a bemused expression.
sentence.Network_cn: 塞巴斯蒂安先生一脸茫然地看着男孩儿们。

sentence.Network_en: He was rather bemused by children.
They all sat still, all bemused by the beauty of the thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们都寂然不动地坐着, 冥想这个东西多么好.

entry.def: If you are bemused, you are puzzled or confused.

example.ex: He was rather bemused by children...
Mr. Sebastian was looking at the boys with a bemused expression.
example.tran: 塞巴斯蒂安先生一脸茫然地看着男孩儿们。

sentences.sentence: "as distant and bemused as a professor listening to the prattling of his freshman class"

means.word_mean: 2. perplexed by many conflicting situations or statements; filled with bewilderment;

sentences.sentence: "she felt lost on the first day of school"
